p: Across a group of models, with consistent λ F and λ C, Eq. M13 would be expected to give rise to correlations of Δ F R − R F on Δ F A, the atmospheric model surface heat flux biases. Again, it is necessary to assume, as expected, that Δ F A and (Δ C O + R F + R C) are approximately uncorrelated. The slope of this regression (S 3) then provides an estimate for - λ F / ( λ F + λ C). We find a strong negative correlation for modified R3 modified ( ∆F R − R F) on ∆F A ( r = −0.84, S 3 = −0.54 ± 0.09, p = 1.5E-5). This provides an estimate of λ F/( λ F + λ C) of 0.54 ± 0.09, which is consistent with the values of λ F and λ C which we estimated from subsections R1 and R2, but appears to provide a slightly better constrained estimate of λ C/ λ F = 0.85 (0.58 to 1.2). With our known parameters (i.e. Δ T, Δ F R and Δ F A) , this relationship could potentially prove useful in other regions, e.g. where λ F is large but the standard deviation of Δ C O is larger than that of Δ F A so that the Δ T on Δ F A correlation is weak.
